numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I notice a correlation between parent income and college acceptance.
2. If a student's parent income is higher then the student is more likely to be accepted to college.
3. If a student's parent income is lower then the student is less likely to be accepted to college.
4. Legacy status helps a student to be accepted to college.
5. If a student does not have legacy status then the student has a below-average admission rate.
6. I wonder how much a higher income influences college acceptance.
7. A student can be rich.
8. A student can fail to meet the college requirements.
9. I wonder whether a college accepts a rich student who does not meet the college requirements.
10. A student can have a lower income.
11. A student can meet all college requirements.
12. I wonder whether a college accepts a lower-income student who meets all college requirements.
13. This issue is relevant to my community.
14. This issue contributes to social inequality.
15. This issue limits educational opportunities for people who have a lower income.
16. I think that this situation is not fair.
17. If a person has a higher income then the person is more likely to be accepted to college than a person who struggles financially.
18. This situation creates an environment.
19. In this environment, success is tied to a higher income.
20. The headline is: The Secret to Instant Admission Revealed!
